title: `eth_call` is sent to Nethermind with field not included in API specification.
body:
# üêû Bug Report ### Description In Nethermind we reverted one of the changes and ensured that our eth_call is according to the spec: https://[ethereum.github.io/execution-apis/api-documentation/](https://ethereum.github.io/execution-apis/api-documentation/) One of important things is to have "input" field on transaction details. When this adjustment was made, noticed that on any node with Prysm (sepolia/mainnet/goerli) we started getting errors: ``` Error when handling ID 3, eth_call({ "data": "0x621fd130", "from": "0x0000000000000000000000000000000000000000", "to": "0x7f02c3e3c98b133055b8b348b2ac625669ed295d" },latest) | {"jsonrpc":"2.0","error":{"code":-32015,"message":"VM execution error.","data":"revert"},"id":3} ``` After some investigation we noticed, that instead of receiving "input" from prysm we got "data". When we reverted that change everything is fine for now, but the usage of eth_call in that scenario is not matching the API specifications mentioned above. ### Has this worked before in a previous version? Yes, until we adjusted according to spec. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction I guess it is quite self explanatory from Description - as for now Nethermind handles both fields but we would like to support only one as described in spec. ## üî• Error 

Error when handling ID 3, eth_call({
  "data": "0x621fd130",
  "from": "0x0000000000000000000000000000000000000000",
  "to": "0x7f02c3e3c98b133055b8b348b2ac625669ed295d"
},latest) | {"jsonrpc":"2.0","error":{"code":-32015,"message":"VM execution error.","data":"revert"},"id":3}
## üåç Your Environment **Operating System:** 
  
Ubuntu 22.04, Docker installation of Prysm and nethermind
**What version of Prysm are you running? (Which release)** 
  
4.0.8
